speaker: Doctor
text: What other symptoms are you experiencing besides agitation and the yellowish coloring of your skin and eyes?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been feeling really restless and confused, like I can't focus on anything. Sometimes I even feel like I'm not really here. Also, I've had some nosebleeds lately.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your appetite or weight recently?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't really noticed much change in my appetite, but I feel a bit off. I don't think I've lost or gained any weight recently, though.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any abdominal pain or discomfort, particularly in the upper right quadrant?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any abdominal pain or discomfort that I can recall. Just feeling really anxious and out of sorts.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent infections, illnesses, or been exposed to any toxins or medications that could have affected your liver?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any recent infections that I know of, but I did use some ecstasy a few days ago. I'm not sure if that could be related, though.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your urine color or stool color recently?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't really paid much attention to my urine or stool color, but I feel like something's off. I guess I could check, but I haven't noticed anything specific.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any itching or rashes on your skin?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any itching or rashes, but my skin does feel a bit different. It's hard to explain, just feels off.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent blood tests done, particularly liver function tests or a complete blood count?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any blood tests done recently. I just came in because I was feeling really agitated and my family was worried about the yellowing of my skin and eyes.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you consumed any alcohol or recreational drugs in the past few weeks, aside from the ecstasy you mentioned?

speaker: Patient
text: I've only had some drinks on the weekends, just socially. I don't think I've done anything else besides the ecstasy and the occasional cocaine use.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your sleep patterns, such as insomnia or excessive sleepiness?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been having trouble sleeping, like I can't settle down at all. I feel really restless at night and just can't seem to get comfortable.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any family history of liver disease or any other significant medical conditions?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't know of any family history of liver disease. My family is generally healthy, as far as I know.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any swelling in your abdomen or legs, or any unusual bruising?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any swelling in my abdomen or legs, but I did have a couple of bruises that appeared out of nowhere. It's strange, I don't remember bumping into anything.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any fever, chills, or other signs of infection recently?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any fever or chills that I can recall. I just feel really on edge and out of it.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent travel history or exposure to someone with hepatitis or liver disease?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't traveled anywhere recently, and I don't know anyone with liver disease. I mostly just hang out with friends on the weekends.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent changes in your mental state, such as increased anxiety, confusion, or mood swings?

speaker: Patient
text: Yeah, I've definitely been feeling more anxious and confused lately. It's like my mind is racing, and I can't keep track of what's going on around me. My mood swings have been all over the place too.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any episodes of vomiting or nausea recently?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't really felt nauseous, but I do feel a bit off in my stomach sometimes. No vomiting, though. Just a general sense of unease.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent dental work or procedures that could have led to bleeding or bruising?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't had any dental work done recently. The bruising just seemed to appear out of nowhere, which is really strange to me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent changes in your menstrual cycle, if applicable, or any unusual bleeding?

speaker: Patient
text: I don't have a menstrual cycle, but I have noticed some unusual nosebleeds lately. It's not something that usually happens to me.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any changes in your energy levels or fatigue?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been feeling really drained and low on energy. It's like I can't muster the motivation to do anything, and I just want to sleep all the time.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any recent exposure to any chemicals or substances that could be harmful to your liver, aside from the recreational drugs you've mentioned?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't been exposed to any chemicals or substances that I know of. Just the occasional party scene with friends, but nothing out of the ordinary.

speaker: Doctor
text: REQUEST TEST: Liver_Function_Tests

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Bilirubin: 25 mg/dL (elevated), AST: 600 IU/L (elevated), ALT: 650 IU/L (elevated), TP Activity: < 40% (reduced), INR: 1.5 (elevated)

speaker: Doctor
text: Maximum inferences reached

speaker: Patient
text: I feel really overwhelmed by everything that's happening. It's hard to process it all, especially with how restless and confused I've been feeling. I just want to understand what's going on with me.
